item.title: How do i?
item.dc:creator: @java_coder java coder™
item.description:
@java_coder wrote:

[quote=“Bobbert, post:3, topic:106899”]That isnt helping him ,

[code]
case 2873:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“Saradomin Grants You Attack .”);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(0x326);
addSkillXP((300playerLevel[2]), 0);
addSkillXP((100playerLevel[3]), 3);
addSkillXP((80*playerLevel[18]), 18);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

[code]

Thats one for a saradomin statue giving you attack Xp

So Case 2873 - Replace 2873 with the Object ID you want to give xp
addSkillXP((300playerLevel[2]), 0);
addSkillXP((100playerLevel[3]), 3);
addSkillXP((80*playerLevel[18]), 18);

Ok So Line 1 - 300 Attack xp See 300* and the 0 at the end is attack i belive
Next Line 100 Hp Xp see 100* and 3
At the end Is 80 Slayer Xp 18 would be the slayer skill

	sendMessage("Saradomin Grants You Attack .");

Change That Line to the message you wish to recive when you click it

	actionTimer = 20;

change the 20 to 10 if you wish this is how often you can click on it (i belive its divided by 10 and its then in seconds ie . every 2 secs )

	setAnimation(0x326);

You Chnage this for a differnt animation for this im realy not to sure .[/code][/code][/quote]

thank you i bearly learning java. im in my first few weeks almost a month.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i?
item.dc:creator: @Bobbert Bobbert
item.description:
@Bobbert wrote:

That isnt helping him ,

case 2873:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
	if(actionTimer == 0)
	{
		sendMessage("Saradomin Grants You Attack .");
		actionTimer = 20;
		setAnimation(0x326);
		addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[2]), 0);
		addSkillXP((100*playerLevel[3]), 3);
                addSkillXP((80*playerLevel[18]), 18);
                updateRequired = true;
                appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	}
}
break;

Thats one for a saradomin statue giving you attack Xp

So Case 2873 - Replace 2873 with the Object ID you want to give xp

addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[2]), 0); addSkillXP((100*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((80*playerLevel[18]), 18);

Ok So Line 1 - 300 Attack xp See 300* and the 0 at the end is attack i belive
Next Line 100 Hp Xp see 100* and 3
At the end Is 80 Slayer Xp 18 would be the slayer skill

		sendMessage("Saradomin Grants You Attack .");

Change That Line to the message you wish to recive when you click it

actionTimer = 20;
change the 20 to 10 if you wish this is how often you can click on it (i belive its divided by 10 and its then in seconds ie . every 2 secs )

setAnimation(0x326);
You Chnage this for a differnt animation for this im realy not to sure .

addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[2]), 2); That Line there is for strenght Xp

So A code For an object giving strenght XP would be

case ObjectId: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Youv Been Granted Strenght Xp."); actionTimer = 10; setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[2]), 2); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

Just add the object id were i say “object Id”

Then Place that case

below the breack in case 1306

So it looks like this

case 1306: Woodcutting("magic", 1, 75, 1513, 1, objectID, objectX, objectY, 875); break; case ObjectId: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Youv Been Granted Strenght Xp."); actionTimer = 10; setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[2]), 2); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;
